text: Transcriptional activity and constitutive nuclear localization of the ETS protein <extra_id_0> Elf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
<extra_id_0> Elf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a lymphoid - specific transcription factor that belongs to the ETS protein family .
It can bind to DNA target sequences within a variety of cytokine genes .
We demonstrate that <extra_id_0> Elf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is constitutively localized in the nucleus which is dependent on the presence of amino acids 86-265 .

text: Analysis of <extra_id_0> Gal4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> Elf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> fusion proteins revealed that the N-terminal 86 amino acids of <extra_id_0> Elf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> contain a transcriptional activation domain , the activity of which is attenuated by an internal repression domain .

Furthermore , <extra_id_0> Elf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> interacts specifically with the E74 target sequence and can stimulate transcription driven by the E74 site independent of mitogenic signaling .
Thus , <extra_id_0> Elf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is able to stimulate gene transcription which may be required for the development and activity of lymphocytes .
